src.tasks package

Submodules

src.tasks.task_client module

src.tasks.task_client.run_task(case_path, module_data, task, queue, case_uuid)[source]

Submits a task for asynchronous execution using Celery, specifying the task’s parameters and execution queue.

Parameters:

  • case_path (str) – The base directory path where the case files are stored and operations will be performed.

  • module_data (bytes) – Serialized data of the module instance to be processed in the task.

  • task (str) – The name of the task function to execute.

  • queue (str) – The name of the Celery queue in which the task should be enqueued.

  • case_uuid (str) – A unique identifier for the case associated with the task.

Environment Variables:

CELERY_BROKER_URL (str): The URL of the Celery message broker. CELERY_RESULT_BACKEND (str): The URL of the backend used to store task results.

src.tasks.task_manager module

class src.tasks.task_manager.ProcessorJob(case_path, profile, selected_modules, modules_to_add, modules_to_remove)[source]

Bases: object

Manages the configuration and validation of processing modules based on a specified profile and user inputs.

src.tasks.tasks module

class src.tasks.tasks.CeleryWorker[source]

Bases: object

Manages a Celery worker that handles task execution in a distributed environment, supporting different processing modes based on the configuration and environment.

start_worker()[source]

Starts multiple Celery workers based on system resources and configuration, managing different task queues for processing.
